channel.title: Making a sprite load server-sided?
channel.description:
So I am trying to make my maps jam randomly, but I'm not sure how to make sprites load server sided so that the map can turn blank.
Thanks, Arham

item.title: Making a sprite load server-sided?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:18, topic:431578”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=534256.msg3906165#msg3906165 date=1328239030]

^There are frame you can use to dim & black out the map. I do not believe you can do much with it server sided though.

You can do one of two things I’m thinking;

Make the minimap inactive (requires no client-side modification)
Remove the player dots from the map (requires slight client-side modification).

[/quote]
The first is done in barrows when going down into the crypt.

Using this code;
getPA().sendFrame99(2);[/quote]

how would I make it a limit. Like, how long. From an int or boolean?

Read full topic

Remove the player dots from the map (requires slight client-side modification).[/quote]

item.title: Making a sprite load server-sided?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

ofc it can be done…

Have the server pool players and whatever players are pking tell the client to blur their minimap/screen. You will just have to create the method yourself client sided and a little networking.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a sprite load server-sided?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

There is a limit on what you can do to the client server sided, this what you’re trying to do, unfortunately cannot be done.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a sprite load server-sided?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:10, topic:431578”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=534256.msg3906091#msg3906091 date=1328235452]

Why not add the sprites client sided. then have some sort of server sided code call them randomly through out game play.

How do server codes call to client codes?

That I’m not to sure of but I know for a fact it’s possible, I mean look when you type <img=3> into yell on most PI’s.

أوه، حسنا، الإجابة على أي شخص آخر ستعمل؟

:P, Arabic for “Oh, okay, anyone else gonna answer?”
[/quote]

Does anyone here look like he’s interested in learning arabic?..[/quote]

Off topic: I learn Arabic actually, this is google translate keyboard.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a sprite load server-sided?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:4, topic:431578”]It’s for T.U.Pk.S

[quote author=T.U.Pk.S - Banner! - The.Ultimate.PKing.Server]
An amazing feature, which no RSPS may have thought of will be on, during wilderness tournaments, maps might jam (or to become very blurry) after a certain amount of time, making the tournament to be even more exciting! Isn’t that amazing? “Madai, madai, radar jammed, oh damn, they’re here, ahhhhhhh!”
[/quote][/quote]

There’s no way to modify the minimap in that way server-side.

The most you could do is blackout the minimap. Anything more would require client-side editing.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a sprite load server-sided?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

It’s for T.U.Pk.S

T.U.Pk.S - Banner! - The.Ultimate.PKing.Server:

An amazing feature, which no RSPS may have thought of will be on, during wilderness tournaments, maps might jam (or to become very blurry) after a certain amount of time, making the tournament to be even more exciting! Isn’t that amazing? “Madai, madai, radar jammed, oh damn, they’re here, ahhhhhhh!”
